intro: Manettia paniculata, commonly known as the white-flowered manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in terminal panicles. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Manettia paniculata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and pleasant scent.
